page.title: 13DEWSBURY'S POPULATION CHANGE
page.content: At Eastborough school 15 years ago 5% of the children were of Asian origin. Now there are 67%,and the younger classes have considerably more, one class being 100% Asian. Attracted by employment in the textile industry,the families tended to occupy large terrace housing, and areas like Savile Town and Crackenedge are predominantly populated by Asians. Whilst 20% of Asian children were born in Pakistan most can speak English,even though at home they revert to their native tongue of Punjabi or Urdu in conversation with parents.Most are devout and regular attenders of the mosque,many children going 5 times a week,though older girls and mothers tend to pray at home.Few Asian families go on annual holiday, but they ofen visit relatives far away and many have visited their homeland.
